reviews.title: Great way to visit Islands
text: Very easy to use, we hopped on to go to the Toronto Islands. Cheap transport, efficient and good overall experience.
Definitely worth using.

reviews.title: Efficient and Easy
text: Getting to the ferry terminal is fairly easy - though parking is spotty. We were fine but we had a decent walk to get there. Once we did, buying a ticket was a piece of cake and they gave us a schedule, so we didn't have to worry how and when to get back from which ferry stop on the islands. They are not super close to each other if you are walking (they look close on the map but you can't cut across to shorten the walk). But the ferries themselves were clean and smooth.

reviews.title: Short and easy trip to Centre Island
text: I took an early ferry on a summer weekday. It was easy to buy a ticket at the booth, and the boat wasn't crowded at all. It's a short ride to the island with great views of the city. The ferry times were pretty much on schedule.

reviews.title: Nice trip to Toronto Island
text: It was a nice trip during very nice weather. The boat ride was quick, fair price and the island was pretty as well. Beautiful places to see everywhere

reviews.title: Dire queuing for the ferries
text: As a family, we decided to visit Toronto Island and without any knowledge of the island, we opted for the Centre Island Ferry. Booking the tickets was fine. The ferry journey over was fine. Queuing for the ferry was a horrible experience. There is no queuing system, people just simply wait and converge by the big iron gates, once they're opened, you'll attempt to get onto the ferry and grab a seat. There's nothing to stop people barging and pushing past you. If you're going as an individual or in a group of grown ups, it's fine. However with two very young children, it was a very poor experience.

reviews.title: Nice service to get to the islands
text: You can buy tickets in advance or buy on location. Both lines went quite fast despite somewhat holiday season on a Monday morning. We were with a bicycle so we just picked up the first ferry available once we bought our tickets. The timetables available for each station makes it easy to plan your return back. The ferries are quite punctual, and plenty of space for bikes and for taking a rest or making nice photos.

reviews.title: Bad Service
text: Terrible experience ever !!!

We visited with our friends from Kitchener, enjoyed in central island but the service of ferry was not at all contented. People were waiting since 3 hours for ferry. Even ferry was not running as per the schedule. In website they have mentioned to increase frequency when it is crowded or bad weather. It was crowded, raining but still just 1 boat was serving all passengers. All the people including kids, elderly were exhausted and tired. Not at all happy with today’s trip.

reviews.title: Beautiful view on Toronto
text: I recommend going to Toronto Island, it's really beautiful. During the day, you can walk around the Island depending where you are dropped off, but the walk can be more or less longer. You have a wonderful view of the city. If you want a break, it's the perfect place to go. You can also go just for the sun set. Personally, I love the view.

reviews.title: A must to visit the islands
text: We loved our visit to the islands. The ferry runs about every 40 minutes, with different ferries heading to the three main islands. The islands are connected so you can travel back from any of the islands with the $9.11 return ticket. The views of Toronto skyline from the ferry deck were amazing.

reviews.title: A must if visiting
text: This was one of my favourite things to do in Toronto. The price of a ticket includes a return trip from any one of the three ferry stations. The ferry offers to best photo views of the Toronto skyline. A must if visiting

reviews.title: Great day out
text: One of the best things to do in Toronto is to visit the island park. The terminal is an easy walk from the Union station. The Jack Layton Ferry Terminal (the ferry docks) is located between Bay Street and Yonge Street on Queens Quay. Ferry boats go to three different Islands: Centre, Hanlan's and Ward's Island (inter-connected). Cost is $8.70/person return tickets.

reviews.title: Worth just the boat trip (15 min).
text: Pleasant boat excursion to central island . Takes about 15 min and boat leaves on the dot, not waiting for your late butt.
Parking situation is poorly explained and could have better options on their website. We paid $20 flat fee nearby and walked 5 min.

Wish the boats would also have dedicated corridor/lane for strollers, families with small children. Rather pathetic seeing zero common sense or civility of certain adults trying to push through, almost trampling kids or cutting off strollers so they can be first on the boat to get their golden seats or to disembark.
Ferry company could do better for a more enjoyable embarkation/disembarkation.
It was great that if purchase tickets online, one kept left and walk all the way to kiosk Vs standing in queue…
Had a great time on the boat.

**sidenote-never grab a coffee and a food item (eg wrap/bagel) at nearby Tims on queens quarry before embarking. They are incredibly slow to get order running. Enjoy the boat trip and grab cofeee on the island tbh

reviews.title: Very comfortable ride!!!
text: Reliable service, boat has one of the best views of the Toronto skyline you can find!!!  Clean boat with lots of great vantage points

reviews.title: 5 minute journey back to Toronto
text: Took a water taxi there and a free ferry back - good fun - smooth and quick way to get back to Roronto

reviews.title: Free service - excellent
text: We used this free service to hop over to Toronto Island for a few hours. Great service, easy to use and they run regularly.

reviews.title: Cheap way to get to the Toronto Islands
text: Price wise this is a very cheap and easy way to get to the Toronto Islands.
My complaint is that it didn't feel very safe boarding the boat.

It was a hot summers day and they packed everybody into an open space outside of the gate to the ferry. It's not very safe for elderly people, children and people with push chairs. It wouldn't be too difficult to get a queue in place on busy days.
I'm from the UK and was getting Hillsborough vibes.

reviews.title: okay
text: This is a great way to get to the island as it's not expensive and there's a boat every 20/30 mins or so.

reviews.title: Rented a Car on the Island
text: Drove the car rental to the mainland. Fast service, took ferry back to the mainland, staff were professional and looked after us and kept us safe.

reviews.title: Nice View
text: A nice relaxing experience to do, especially around sunset. The city views are unbeatable from the ferry.

reviews.title: A pleasant and quick trip to Centre Island
text: Walked  from the ferry terminal on Centre Island and returned via the Ward's Island ferry.  We took the boardwalk along the lake and arrived at a lovely restaurant where we ate lunch under the huge trees.  The ferry ride is only about 10 minutes.

reviews.title: Fun water ride
text: Fun water ride. Great views of Toronto coming and going. Three beaches to choose from, one being the clothing optional beach. Water was calm but cold.

reviews.title: Cheap and easy
text: $9 round trip, quick and easy, pay attention to the schedule!   We missed the return at 8:00pm by a minute, and the next one was 9:00pm.  You can take the ferry to one location and return from another.  (Water taxis are an option if you don’t want to follow schedules.)

reviews.title: Terrible this year
text: You will be swarmed by mosquitoes this year. Even if you wear repellent you will get at least 20 bites and this is during the day. There is more swampy water thru out and the lake is higher than its been in a long time. Obviously the City is not bothering to spray for  mosquitoes and apparently West Nile has been reported in past summers. There was a 5 foot brownish yellowish scum right along the whole western shoreline when I was there and I couldn't believe people were swimming thru it.  The debris and garbage along the western beach was incredible.

reviews.title: Easy to use. Go early by ticket ahead
text: We decided to go to Toronto Island at the last minute. At 10 a.m., it was a short  line and an easy process to get to the ferry. When we came back around 3:30 pm, the line to get the ferry and cross to the island was kilometric with hundreds of people waiting. If you can buy tickets in advance as they have a special line for ticket holders.

reviews.title: Worth a trip to see iconic Toronto skyline
text: The boats are weathered, but it’s worth a visit to take a picture of the skyline at night. I recommend going there to watch the sunset and snap a picture at Twilight. The ferries are usually on time and it’s a quick trip to get to and from the islands

reviews.title: Good Value
text: Very punctual and  well worth taking it to see some great views of Toronto and its surrounding areas. Can get busy, just choose  the right time and get there early.

reviews.title: Great ferry to Central Island
text: Very convenient taking ferry to central island which is a must go place. Beautiful view for the Toronto from the ferry . It runs every 15 minutes, it only takes around 15 minutes ride of the ferry.

reviews.title: Great Fun
text: We took the ferry from the dock to Harlans point and returned via Centre island.  The ferry is a great value. The ferry was well organized and a great way to get to Toronto Island

reviews.title: Good and cheap
text: Nice and easy way to get to the islands.  Very cheap and the ride to and from has beautiful scenery.  Schedule is not always on time but very close to the time .

reviews.title: Quick, efficient, & relatively cheap to get to the islands
text: This would have been 5 stars but they didn't stick to their schedule at all. We got lucky in that we got to the dock 15 minutes before the scheduled departures, so we just barely made it on the ferry both times. The line to get tickets at the ferry was huge but there were signs saying to get tickets online and then just show that at the entry area with basically no line, so we did that and it took me about 3 minutes to purchase round trip tickets for 2 adults for the day. The ferry goes quickly from dock to dock and the views of downtown and the islands are awesome!

reviews.title: Take some warm / waterproof clothing for the crossing!
text: Pretty cheap and easy to use but I imagine in the summer months they're busy. Remember to take some warm / waterproof clothing... the ferry crossing and to have it's own micro climate!!!

reviews.title: Was ok
text: The ferry itself was like a car ferry. Staff were friendly enough except for the person who took the money for your ticket. Maybe they were having an off day but were quite rude when asked a question bout ferry times and was just told to take a photo in a very abrupt way

reviews.title: Good view and travel
text: This is an experience you should consider in your itinerary !! You can get an amazing view of Toronto City and the breeze during the cruise is gorgeous!! The islands are good although we couldn't walk at all because they are so big and it was so cold!! But in general, it is an amazing experience

reviews.title: Pleasant quiet day out
text: Quick, easy & cost effective trip to the islands. There wasn't much open on a week day in September, but we enjoyed a walk from Ward's Island along the boardwalk to Centre Island & Olympic Island & then out to Gibralter Point Lighthouse, returning back on the ferry from Centre Island.

reviews.title: Boat Trip
text: A nice trip across the lake to the islands. Speedy boarding and regular service. Great views back to the Toronto skyline.

reviews.title: Good service
text: The ferry service was affordable, punctual, and quick. The ride was pleasant as I could admire the scenic view of the downtown.

reviews.title: Friendly, fast efficient
text: I didn't want to get the water taxis, the ferry is always a better choice.
Great views of the skyline.
The staff are great, the greet you boarding on and off, a nice touch.
A place flew over to land which was a great experience too.

reviews.title: The ferry ride is great, but organization while waiting for the ferry is very bad
text: To use ferry to go to Central Island is easy and cheap. You can buy tickets at the ticket office in the port or online. The journey itself is quick, taking about 15 minutes to Central Island, and you can see the iconic Toronto skyline from the deck of the boat.

What was bad was zero organization while waiting for the ferry. A crowd of people (200 or maybe more) was waiting to be let on the boat. When that happened, people started rushing forward, pushing each other, there were a lot of people with baby carriages, which they ran (albeit unintentionally) into other people's feet. Everything was incredibly chaotic. At the same time, it would be quite enough to put a zig zag line here and boarding on the ferry would be more comfortable.

On the way back, there were only about 20 people on the ferry, so the boarding was much easier. It was also possible to take beautiful photos of the Toronto skyline, because the ferry was almost empty and you could walk around the deck without any problems.

reviews.title: Dangerous ferry line up and ridiculous wait times
text: I was so disapointed with my Centre Island experience today. We left Centreville 30 minutes before it closed to line up for the ferry back to the city. We stood in a tightly packed crowd for at least 20 minutes while I worried about my child getting trampled. Once the boat arrived we moved forward with the crowd but made it only as far as the holding cage. The boat left. The next ferry was not coming for another hour, and we couldn't wait with a small tired child in that crowd. It cost my family $50 to get back from the Island in a private water taxi.

The ferries need to increase service and coordinate with Centreville's opening hours. Safety measures are also needed to prevent crowding and the anxiety of hopeful passengers. Simple things like a zig zag line, like that used for example for rides or airport customs, could ensure a clear line with adequate personal space (especially for children). Turnstiles at the entry to those lines could count potential passengers and clearly signal when the maximun is reached, without people waiting in line for unreasonable lengths if time, only to miss the boat and have to continue waiting.
It is a shame to have such a beautiful space in this city and not be able to visit.

reviews.title: Bad, horrible, terrible, awful, horrendous, garbage,
text: We waited for over an hour in the crowd of the line before the line even moved. Would like to give 0 stars if possible.
